Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
CAN: Illustrate a basic design of a string telephone showing two cups and a string between them.
Show the general idea that the string is a part of the communication device, but might miss the importance of tightness or length.
Depict simple indications of the sound concept, such as lines or arrows showing sound traveling from one cup to the other.
CANNOT: Provide a clear illustration of how the string must be taut for effective communication (student may draw a slack string).
Show all materials used beyond cups and string, possibly misidentifying materials or omitting them.

Accurately depict features that enhance communication, such as using a longer string to mimic distance or closed environments reducing external noise (student may think any setup will work regardless of distance or environment).
Illustrate how sound travels as vibrations clearly, possibly confusing sound with electricity or other forms of energy.
